blocks.html: Publication of the communication of an approved standard amendment to a product specification of a geographical indication in accordance with Article 5(4) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2025/27 ( 1 )
COMMUNICATION OF APPROVAL OF A STANDARD AMENDMENT

(Article 24 of Regulation (EU) 2024/1143)
'Prado de Irache'
EU reference number: PDO-ES-A0182-AM02 – 6.11.2025
1.Name of product
'Prado de Irache'
2.Geographical indication type
PDO
PGI
GI
3.Sector
Agricultural products
Wines
Spirit drinks
4.Country to which the geographical area belongs
Spain
5.Member State authority communicating the standard amendment
Name
Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food. Directorate-General for Food. Subdirectorate-General for Food Quality
Control and Agri-Food Laboratories.
6.Qualification as standard amendment
The competent authority considers this amendment to the Prado de Irache PDO product specification to be a
standard amendment; it cannot be regarded as a Union amendment since it does not correspond to any of the
situations referred to in Article 24(3) of Regulation (EU) 2024/1143 on geographical indications. Specifically, it does
not: include a change in the name or in the use of the name, or in the category of product or products designated by
the geographical indication; risk voiding the link with the geographical area; entail further restrictions on the
marketing of the product.
7.Description of the approved standard amendment(s)
Title

( ) Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2025/27 of 30 October 2024 supplementing Regulation (EU) 2024/1143 of the European Parliament and of the Council with rules concerning the registration and the protection of geographical indications, traditional specialities guaranteed and optional quality terms and repealing Delegated Regulation (EU) No 664/2014 (OJ L, 2025/27, 15.1.2025, ELI: http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_del/2025/27/oj).

The purpose of the changes is ensure that the organoleptic descriptors for each type of wine are clarified, specified and/or objectively considered at the different phases of assessment (appearance, aroma and taste) by tasting panels

operating in accordance with standard UNE-EN ISO/IEC 17065. Characterisation by variety has also been removed,
since it is considered unnecessary.
These amendments concern point 2(b) of the product specification and point 6 of the single document.
The amendment affects the single document.
Title
UPDATED DETAILS
Description
The contact details (name, telephone number and e-mail address) of the competent authority and the e-mail address
of the control body have been updated.
This amendment concerns point 9 of the product specification and does not affect the single document.
The amendment affects the single document.
SINGLE DOCUMENT
Designations of origin and geographical indications of wine
'Prado de Irache'
EU reference number: PDO-ES-A0182-AM02 – 6.11.2025
1.Name(s)
'Prado de Irache'
2.Geographical indication type
PDO
PGI
GI
3.Country to which the defined geographical area belongs
Spain
4.Classification of the agricultural product in accordance with the Combined Nomenclature heading and code,
as referred to in Article 6(1) of Regulation (EU) 2024/1143
2204 – Wine of fresh grapes, including fortified wines; grape must other than that of heading 2009
5. Categories of grapevine product as listed in Part II of Annex VII to Regulation (EU) No 1308/2013
Clear, bright colour of medium to high intensity which can range from purple to ruby red for young wines, and from purple-red to red with russet tints for wines exposed to wood.
Medium to high intensity aroma, with no defects and fruity and/or woody tones.
Balanced, medium to full body, well integrated acidity which gives the wines freshness, with a fruity and/or woody retronasal aroma and a medium to long finish.

Maximum total alcoholic strength (in % volume):—
Minimum actual alcoholic strength (in % volume):12
Minimum total acidity:3,7
Minimum total acidity unit:in grams per litre expressed as tartaric acid
Maximum volatile acidity (in milliequivalents per litre):—
Maximum total sulphur dioxide (in milligrams per litre):125

Maximum volatile acidity: 0,049 g/l (0,82 meq/l) per % vol. of actual alcoholic strength, expressed as acetic acid, with a limit of 0,70 g/l (11,67 meq/l) in young wines and 0,90 g/l (15 meq/l) in aged wines.
Any analytical characteristics not indicated in this section are within the limits laid down in the applicable EU legislation.
7.1. Specific oenological practices used to make the wine or wines and relevant restrictions on making them
Production of the wine covered by the PDO must be based on the total or partial fermentation of the grapes with the skins of the red grapes, with optional prior destemming.
On no account may the ageing or maturation process be deemed to have started before 1 October in the same year as the harvest.
Relevant restriction on making the wines
The minimum planting density is 2 500 plants per hectare.
Non-localised irrigation systems (sprinkler irrigation or irrigation by flooding) is authorised only until 31 July of each year.
Continuous presses are not permitted in the production of protected wines.

Maximum yield:7 000
Maximum yield per unit:kilograms of grapes per hectare

Maximum yield:7 200
Maximum yield per unit:kilograms of grapes per hectare

Maximum yield:6 800
Maximum yield per unit:kilograms of grapes per hectare
8. Indication of the wine grape variety or varieties from which the wine or wines are produced

• CABERNET SAUVIGNON
  • GARNACHA TINTA
  • GRACIANO
  • MAZUELA MAZUELO
  • MERLOT
  • TEMPRANILLO
9. Concise definition of the demarcated geographical area
Pago Prado de Irache wines are produced on land located in the municipality of Ayegui, in the district of Tierra Estella in Navarre.
The geographical boundaries of Pago Prado de Irache are established as follows:

• North: bounded by plots 354, 1029, 535, 861, the orchards of Zuloandía, the Camino de Igúzquiza and Hoya de Lucea, Gastisun and Sarnabiaga.
  • South: bounded by the Camino de Santiago motorway, the urban development of Irache and Crucipicando.
  • East: bounded by the end of los Romerales and El Robledal.
  • West: bounded by the Camino de Santiago motorway and the Cañada Real de Imas cattle route, which run side by side.

The agricultural, climatic and soil characteristics of the plots on which Pago Prado de Irache vines grow allow for the perfect development of the Tempranillo, Garnacha, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Graciano and Mazuelo grape varieties, which are perfectly suited to the area. Together with the cultivation and oenological techniques used by winegrowers and producers, they guarantee the production of exceptional wines with distinctive personalities.

The key characteristics of wines in this area, which distinguish them from wines produced nearby, are due to the fact that while this area is typified by the Mediterranean climate, it is also heavily influenced by the Atlantic.

The Atlantic influence and the altitude, latitude and location in a relatively closed valley create climate conditions which to a certain extent distance it from the typical Mediterranean climate, giving greater ambient relative humidity, cooler temperatures, heavier precipitation and sharper temperature variations.

Together with the typology of calcareous loose soils of medium to low fertility with low levels of organic material, this explains the main characteristics of the red wine, which are linked to its acidity.
The label of the protected product must clearly display the name 'Vino de Pago Prado de Irache'.
